CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: As the key building block selenium - containing heterocyclic intermediate di(2′-selenienyl)-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) 6^12 was prepared by Pd - catalyzed Stille coupling reaction of dibromobenzothiadiazole 4 and monostannylselenophene 5 , which was then dibrominated by N-bromosuccinimide ( NBS ) to yield comonomer M2 ( 2 steps , 52% overall yield ). The target poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) was obtained by Suzuki polymerization of M1 and M2 in degassed toluene / water with K 3 PO 4 as an organic base , Pd 2 ( dba ) 3 as a catalyst , and P(o-tol) 3 as the corresponding ligand at 90 °C for 3 days. The crude polymer was purified by reprecipitation and Soxhlet extraction with methanol , acetone , hexane , and chlorobenzene. Details of synthesis of monomers , polymerization , and their characterizations are given in the Experimental Section. After purification , gel - permeation chromatography ( GPC ) analysis against PS standard exhibits a number - averaged molecular mass ( M n ) of 83^000 g / mol with a polydispersity ( PDI ) of 2.51. The polymer is readily soluble in common solvents such as chloroform , toluene , THF , and chlorobenzene. As shown in Figure 1a , the UV - vis absorption spectra of PCDSeBT both in chloroform solution and solid state exhibit two distinct absorption bands , as typically observed for donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) low bandgap materials. The absorption maxima ( λ max ) of the film are located at 403 and 589 nm. The shorter absorption band is due to π-π* transitions of the polymer backbone , 13 while the lower - energy peak is attributed to intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) in the electron - rich and electron - deficient units. 14 It is worth noting that the maxima absorption values of PCDSeBT in the film are slightly broadened without any obvious red - shift when compared to the solution. This verifies that only a small reorganization via π-π stacking between the polymer chains is within view during the film formation because of the interchain aggregates in solution. 15 This observation is in contrast to many conjugated polymers , in which there is a red - shift that occurs in going from the solution to the solid state due to the aggregation of the polymer chains in the solid state , 3,16 even the PCDTBT film is red - shifted by 30 nm vs solution. 5a Besides , the deep blue color of PCDSeBT solution is observed unlike the red color of PCDTBT in solution ( see the digital photograph in Figure 1a ). Notably , although the absorption profile of PCDSeBT is similar to that of the thiophene analogue , PCDTBT , the absorption onset of PCDSeBT is significantly red - shifted by ∼ 70 nm , corresponding to a lower optical bandgap ( E g opt = 1.70 eV ) than PCDTBT ( E g opt = 1.85 eV ).

Let's think step by step.

1. Selenium
2. Heterocyclic intermediate di(2′-selenienyl)-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DSeBT)
3. N-bromosuccinimide (NBS)
4. Comonomer M2
5. Poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) (PCDSeBT)
6. Monomers
7. Polymerization
8. PS standard (polystyrene standard)
9. π-π* transitions of the polymer backbone
10. Intramolecular charge transfer (ICT)
11. Thiophene analogue PCDTBT
12. Optical bandgap (Eg opt)

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. Selenium
2. Heterocyclic intermediate di(2′-selenienyl)-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DSeBT)
3. N-bromosuccinimide (NBS)
4. Comonomer M2
5. Poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) (PCDSeBT)
6. Thiophene analogue PCDTBT
7. Optical bandgap (Eg opt)

These are the entities that clearly refer to Material Names in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Selenium |
| Heterocyclic intermediate di(2′-selenienyl)-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DSeBT) |
| N-bromosuccinimide (NBS) |
| Comonomer M2 |
| Poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) (PCDSeBT) |
| Thiophene analogue PCDTBT |
| Optical bandgap (Eg opt) |

1. Selenium-containing heterocyclic intermediate: di(2′-selenienyl)-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DSeBT)
2. Comonomer: M2
3. Target polymer: poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) (PCDSeBT)
4. Monomers: details of synthesis are given in the Experimental Section
5. Organic base: K 3 PO 4
6. Catalyst: Pd 2 (dba) 3
7. Ligand: P(o-tol) 3
8. Solvents for purification: methanol, acetone, hexane, chlorobenzene
9. Standard for GPC analysis: PS (polystyrene) standard
10. Comparison polymer: PCDTBT (poly[2,7-(9,9-dioctylfluorene)-alt-2,7′-(9,9-dioctyl-fluorene-2,7-diyl)-co-thieno[3,4-b]thiophene])

Let's think step by step.

1. Molecular mass of the polymer PCDSeBT: a number-averaged molecular mass (Mn) of 83^000 g/mol.
2. Polydispersity of the polymer PCDSeBT: 2.51.
3. Absorption maxima (λmax) of the film of PCDSeBT: 403 nm and 589 nm.
4. Optical bandgap (Eg opt) of PCDSeBT: 1.70 eV.
5. Absorption maxima (λmax) of PCDTBT in solution: ~70 nm red-shifted compared to PCDSeBT.
6. Optical bandgap (Eg opt) of PCDTBT: 1.85 eV.

Note: The values for PCDTBT are not explicitly stated in the paragraph, but they can be inferred from the information provided about PCDSeBT.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

4. Optical bandgap (Eg opt) of PCDSeBT: 1.70 eV.

6. Optical bandgap (Eg opt) of PCDTBT: 1.85 eV.
